original_title: Sri Lanka’s mid day shares edge up
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edged up in mid day trade, on the continued sentiments of securing the potential and long awaited $2.9 billion dollars from the International Monetary Fund after China provided assurances to the agreement, an analyst said.
All Share Price Index was up 0.75 percent or 71.90 points to 9,719.76, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was up 0.67 percent or 19.20 points to 2,870.74.
The market had seen some profit taking and selling pressures coming in, as the market is reviving on positive macroeconomic sentiments, an analyst said.
“There has been a renewed interest for retail indexes, while banking and financial sectors have been slow since they were on an uptrend since the news of the IMF broke out,” the analyst said.
The market generated a revenue of 1.3 billion rupees within 1130 hours.
Turnover was focused on big cap counters based on retail indexes.
Top gainers were Vallibel One, JKH and Richard Pieris. (Colombo/Mar09/2023)
